page.title: 17Soloman's Temple /Court Barn
page.content:
Soloman's Temple is the name of two cottages on Werms Lane, locally known as Teapot Lane. These seem to be sarcastically named as they once belonged to the church and were used as parish poor houses.
Court Barn, probably dating back to the early fifteenth century, is the smallest of several surviving tithe barns of Glastonbury Abbey. It has five bays and walls are of coursed rubble. The roof is of a 'base cruck' construction. The tiled roof dates from the 1930's when the National Trust carried out repairs. The remains of a substantial dove cote may be seen on the east wall.
